intro: Bulbophyllum orthosepalum, commonly known as the narrow-sepal orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, often colorful flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients, aiding in its survival in tropical environments.
